lines.text: [At the office of the KPR, the Kinderprotectieraad, in the room of Dr. Ellis]
We don't just mediate between warring partners. We also check up the child itself psychologically. How does the child deal with the conflicts? Our advice is always binding.

Don't take this the wrong way, but you left them. They didn't leave you. You left for another woman. For now, we see no reason to give you custody. And a young kid like Valentijn will be very attached to his mother. This could change for the better if you paid alimony.

[excited]
If I can never see the boys? No cure, no pay! I can't even explain to them why I'm no longer... at their breakfasts!
Because you claim them. Don't you understand she finds that threatening?
[Men walking inside with a new lamp and tools]
They're replacing the lamp. We can continue in the room next door.
I never want to see that mongrel of a child again! Don't do that to me! Let him stay with his mother, for God's sake!

[to Ellis and John]
Sorry, they're replacing the linoleum in my room.
Follow me. We'll find a room.
[opens the door and she and her client walks away]

[sees Valentijn in an opposite room]
Valentijn...

[closes the door]
Sit down, please. You have three daughters. The oldest one is Trudy.
[walks to John and Danny's house, while she is ringing the doorbell]

[from an audible distance]
I wouldn't do that.
I want to talk to her.
I don't think that will help. Too much has happened.
That's why. And I was born under a lucky star.
[she turns back to the door. The door is open and Danny stands there. Jane is totally scared and wheezes]
Oh boy, La Traviata herself. I don't talk to young women who ruin marriages. Who steal the father of my children. Have fun with that bastard!
Leave her alone. You're only making things worse.

[decides to open the door and hits Jahn with a tennis racket]
DIRTY SLUT!
[tries to strangle Jane with the racket and screams]
Stupid woman! If I ever see you again...!
[walks to the entrance of the Anke Bouma School. He impatiently rings the doorbell, hits on the door and on the window]

[talks through the mailbox]
Mr. Gisberts, I am Anke Bouma, the principal. In case of divorce, our school only allows contact with the student after permission from the parent the child lives with. That means I can't help you.

[walks back but decides to open the door]
How dare you kidnap an 8 year old? This is pointless. Try legal means instead. You know our view; you're disturbing the peace. Go away!
[tries to open it, but without luck]

[steals a nearby bike and breaks a window with it]
The Bouma School sucks!

[yelling from his sleeping room]
Mommy, I can't sleep!

[emotional but controls herself pretty well]
I don't know, darling. Daddy has been very mean to mommy. That's why mommy doesn't know if she wants him back. That's why mommy was mad. Now she's only sad, just like you.
Is it because I've been naughty?
[tries to make Valentijn stop worrying about his behaviour]
It's because of that bitch that's ruining my life!
[comes back with a breakfast, especially made for daddy and momma]
A tiger! Your such a darling. Don't you want anything?
He already had breakfast, eh? Right, Valentijn?
No, they stink and shit everywhere.
Congratulazione, 20 years of marriage. Incredibile. Madelon, Dennis and little Gino.
[tries to break the shell with a spoon. Then tries to hit the egg on a saucer. But the egg doesn't break, it is the saucer that does]

[screaming]
That fake egg again! Leave it in the chicken coop! I have told you that 100 times.

[angry]
Jan-Julius got it, not me, dick!
[stands up, hits the ceiling lamp with his head]
Happy anniversary, etc. etc. When you get the eggs, leave the stone egg in the chicken coop. Unless you do it on purpose. Put it back!

[catches the egg]
The chicken will be sitting on a stone, thinking it will become a chick. A bitch doesn't carry a big rock around for 9 months either.
